rules.title: <xref>
rules.abstract: Cross references are links to other topics or to references found on the internet. Good <xref> content informs readers about the target of the link and adapts well to different reuse situations.

rule.rule-statement: If @scope is internal, write sentences that make sense even when hyperlinks are deactivated.
rule.justification: Targets may be available only under some specific reuse scenarios.

examplefig.desc: The sentence makes sense whether the link is active or not, granted that processing leaves the words great wolf in place.
examplefig.codeblock: When you meet a great wolf, don't forget to hide under your invisibility cloak.

rule.rule-statement: Never introduce a link. Never say: Click here. The content of <xref> must define the target.

justification.p: Here is useless when scanning through pages for useful links, especially if there are many here on each page.
